description: From Hindi शलवार (śalvār)/सलवार (salvār) or Urdu شلوار‎ (śalvār)/سلوار‎ (salvār), from Persian شلوار‎ (šalvâr).

entries.meaning: (in singular or plural) Loose trousers worn in some South Asian or Islamic countries, especially by women but also by men, especially with a kamees.
examples: How I longed to have him (my gardener, not my landlord) wear a great big turban, and shalwars, and an ankle bracelet.
